overview_summary: Adjacent landowners include a conservation nonprofit, a major utility, a new speculative LLC, and a public school district. The Wetland Trust (environmental land trust) may resist development impacting wetlands. Niagara Mohawk (National Grid’s utility) controls critical grid infrastructure and is likely neutral or supportive if the project aligns with infrastructure needs. Core Four Group LLC appears to be a recently formed land investment with undisclosed backers, potentially looking to profit or develop, which could pose an unpredictable factor. The RCS school district, as a key local institution, will focus on tax revenue benefits and safety considerations for students, and is unlikely to actively oppose if those interests are addressed.

neighbors.name: The Wetland Trust, Inc.
neighbors.claims: The Wetland Trust, Inc. (TWT) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit land trust in New York dedicated to protecting and restoring wetlands, with a focus on rare amphibian and reptile habitats [Land Trust Alliance](https://landtrustalliance.org/land-trusts/explore/the-wetland-trust-ny). TWT presently owns over 170 wetland properties totaling approximately 7,700 acres across New York State [The Wetland Trust](https://www.thewetlandtrust.org/about/mission/). The organization is funded by grants, donations, and wetland mitigation fees from developers, indicating it often partners on conservation offsets for projects [Land Trust Alliance](https://landtrustalliance.org/land-trusts/explore/the-wetland-trust-ny).
neighbors.influence_justification: Manages thousands of acres and works closely with environmental agencies; respected in conservation circles but not a major economic or political force locally.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage TWT leadership early to address ecological concerns; offer robust wetland buffers or support for their conservation mission to gain goodwill and reduce opposition.

neighbors.name: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp
neighbors.claims: Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation is a major regulated utility in upstate New York, originally incorporated in 1929 (as Niagara Hudson) and now part of National Grid plc’s U.S. operations [Encyclopedia.com](https://www.encyclopedia.com/books/politics-and-business-magazines/niagara-mohawk-power-corporation). Niagara Mohawk serves about 1.5 million electric customers and over 500,000 gas customers across a 24,000-square-mile territory, making it one of New York’s largest energy utilities [Power Engineering](https://www.power-eng.com/operations-maintenance/niagara-mohawk-shareholders-overwhelmingly-approve-merger-with-national-grid-plc/). The company owns extensive transmission lines and substations in the region and is responsible for electricity delivery and grid interconnections for new energy projects [Power Engineering](https://www.power-eng.com/operations-maintenance/niagara-mohawk-shareholders-overwhelmingly-approve-merger-with-national-grid-plc/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Dominant utility provider for the region; controls critical infrastructure; significant institutional and economic presence.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with National Grid’s local management; emphasize mutually beneficial infrastructure upgrades and ensure compliance with utility requirements for interconnection.

neighbors.name: Core Four Group, LLC
neighbors.claims: Core Four Group, LLC is a newly formed limited liability company in New York, filed on August 1, 2025 (NY DOS #7674741) [BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/ny/albany/four-core-group-llc). The company’s mailing address is 418 Broadway, Albany (a corporate registered-agent address), and it is registered through Northwest Registered Agent LLC, suggesting that the actual members/owners are not publicly listed [BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/ny/albany/four-core-group-llc). There are no publicly reported projects or holdings for this LLC beyond the recent land acquisition, indicating it may be a land investment or speculation vehicle with no established community profile.
neighbors.influence_justification: Unknown ownership and purpose; recently formed with no visible local presence or track record.

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the principals behind the LLC discreetly (possibly via its agent or attorney) and gauge their intentions; if they are speculators, consider negotiating a buyout or partnership to preempt opposition or competitive development.

neighbors.name: Ravena-Coeymans-Selkirk Central School District
neighbors.claims: The Ravena-Coeymans-Selkirk Central School District (RCS CSD) is a public school system serving approximately 1,653 students across the towns of Ravena, Coeymans, and part of Bethlehem (Selkirk) in Albany County [NYSED Data](https://data.nysed.gov/profile.php?instid=800000055435). The district operates several schools (elementary, middle, and high school) and had a budget of about $53.5 million for the 2023–24 school year, reflecting its significant role in the community’s education and economy [RCS School District](https://www.rcscsd.org/article/1118515). As a local taxing authority, RCS CSD benefits from commercial development that expands the tax base, but it also prioritizes student safety and minimal disruption around school properties.
neighbors.influence_justification: Major local institution and employer; respected voice on community issues but typically stays apolitical outside of education matters.

approach_recommendations.engage: Communicate openly with the district’s leadership; highlight the project’s contributions to the tax base and address any operational or safety concerns near school facilities to ensure their neutral or positive stance.
